item.title: Bash script
item.description: For some small tasks, sometimes Bash script (shell script in general) is better than a full-blown program using programming languages. Here’s some personal tips to write a Bash script: Exit on fail Use set -o errexit to make the script exit when it fails. If some commands are allowed to fail, command1 || echo "command1 is failed, but continuing" can be used. Prevent access to undeclared variables Use set -o nounset to exit when the script tries to use undeclared variables.
